title: Drawing, "Design for Ceiling Decoration, Probably for Conservatory/Music Room or Perhaps Dining Room", 1802
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Detail of a design for a ceiling divided into three compartments: a square and two half-oval sections. About one quarter of the design is shown, with the square showing the painted representation of a clouded sky, surrounded by a balustrade and bamboo border. Oval with bamboo trellis-work design.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
